thread.title: In the 239: Top 5 things to do this weekend
thread.title_full: In the 239: Top 5 things to do this weekend

title: In the 239: Top 5 things to do this weekend
text:
Next 
5. Can you dig it? 
Actually, yes you can. Family Archaeology Day is from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday at Marco Island Historical Museum, 180 S. Heathwood Drive, Marco Island. 
Sift through much, create your own Calusa mask and learn more about local native cultures. Free. Call 239-642-1440 or visit colliermuseums.com/ 
4. Dance to Salsa 
Celebrate Hispanic Heritage month at the “Fiesta de Culturas”— that’s “Festival of Cultures in English — from noon to 6 p.m. Saturday at Naples Harley-Davidson, 3645 Gateway Lane, Naples. 
There will be live entertainment including salsa dancing lessons and authentic Latin American food. The event is free and open to the public. hdnaples.com 
3. Journey through song 
Take “A romantic journey through Europe” from 4 to 6:30 p.m. Sunday at Koreshan State Historic Site, 3800 Corkscrew Road, Estero. 
The performance is part of the Estero Concert Series. It will feature solo artists Daniela Shtereva on violin and Belina Kostadinova on piano will focus on selections of music by Tchaikovsky, Dvorak, Chopin, Brahms, and more. 
Tickets are available at $40 per person; this price includes entrance to the park. Reservations may be made by calling 239-596-8404 or emailing rcc@rccnales.org. 
2. Go Greek 
A Little Taste of Greece annual festival happens from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Friday and Saturday at The Annunciation Greek Orthodox Church 8210 Cypress Lake Drive, Fort Myers. 
Enjoy your favorite Greek foods such as gyros, Greek Fries, spinach pies, pastries and more. Free. Carry out is available. Call 239-481-2099 or visit annunciation.fl.goarch.org/ 
1. Unleash your inner pirate 
Pirate Fest on Fort Myers Beach starts at 6 p.m. Friday and 9 a.m. Saturday. 
Enjoy all-day entertainment that includes pirates, wenches, corsair and ships at sea firing their cannons. There will be fun for kids and adults. fmbpiratefest.com/ Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
